Constructing a uniform color space for visually lossless color representation and image coding
publication.keyword: Color Space;Image Coding;Image Processing;Just Noticeable Difference;
publication.abstract: A uniform color space in terms of just-noticeable differ- ences (JND) to the human eye is important in industry and image processing, as well as for visually lossless image cod- ing and noise evaluations. The method of this paper builds a non-linear color space, by making use of structural anal- ysis with various JND data sets. Through computer simu- lation,

publication.title: MPEG2 one-pass variable bit rate control algorithm and its LSI implementation
Practical extension to CIELUV color space to improve uniformity
publication.keyword: Color Space;Human Perception;Image Coding;Image Processing;Just Noticeable Difference;
publication.abstract: A uniform chromaticity scale (UCS) in terms of just-noticeable difference (JND) to the human eye is important in industry and image processing, as well as for visually lossless image coding and noise evaluations. CIELUV, which aims at mi- croscopic uniformity to human perception, is widely used in color representation. However, its uniformity needs further improvements. In this paper, we demonstrate

publication.title: A nonlinear spatio-temporal diffusion and its application to prefiltering in MPEG4 video coding
publication.keyword: Anisotropic Diffusion;Blocking Artifact;Compressed Video;Computer Simulation;Video Coding;White Noise;
publication.abstract: A new spatio-temporal pre-filter based on anisotropic diffusion is proposed. The filter has a nonlinear feature; it is capable of smoothing out white noise and insignificant textures in a video sequence in order to improve coding efficiency, while preserving such significant information as object edges. Computer simulation results verify that the subjective quality of a compressed video sequence is usually

publication.title: MPEG4 Very Low Bit-rate Video Compression Using Sprite Coding
publication.jconf: International Conference on Multimedia Computing and Systems/International Conference on Multimedia and Expo
publication.keyword: Global Motion Estimation;Image Quality;Moving Object;Normal Modes;Reduction Method;Video Coding;Video Compression;Video Object Plane;
publication.abstract: This paper focuses on the "sprite coding" that supports the MPEG-4 Version 1 Main profile in order to transfer "near VHS quality video " across narrow-band transmission links such as the Internet. Automatic VOP (Video Object Plane) generation technologies are being studied as one of the most important issues of MPEG-4 object coding. This paper proposes a two-layer VOP generation
